com.appacitive.android.model
Class AppacitiveConnection

java.lang.Object
  com.appacitive.android.model.AppacitiveConnection

public class AppacitiveConnection
extends java.lang.Object

A Connection is represents an edge in a graph and is used to connect two AppacitiveObjects. A Connection itself can store data in its properties and attributes fields.

Author:
Sandeep Dhull

AppacitiveConnection

public AppacitiveConnection(java.lang.String relationType)
Initialize an Connection object of the provided relation type.

Parameters:
relationType - The name of the relation. This is specified while creating the schema.

key - key of the data item to be stored.

tag - The tag to be added to the Connection.

createConnection

public void createConnection()
Create an Connection between two aricles on the remote server. This method requires the articleAId, articleBId, labelA and labelB properties to be set.

createConnection

public void createConnection(AppacitiveCallback callback)
Create an Connection between two articles on the remote server. This method requires the articleAId, articleBId, labelA and labelB properties to be set.

Parameters:
callback - Callback invoked when the create operation is successful or failed.

Creates an Connection between two articles.

Parameters:
objectA - The article to create a connection from.
objectB - The article to create a connection to.

fetchConnections

public static void fetchConnections(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> connectionIds,
                                    java.lang.String relationType)
Fetches multiple Connections from the remote server.

Parameters:
connectionIds - An array of objectIds. Connections with these object id's are fetched.
relationType - The name of the relation. Connections of this relation are retrieved.

fetchConnections

public static void fetchConnections(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> connectionIds,
                                    java.lang.String relationType,
                                    AppacitiveFetchCallback callback)
Fetches multiple Connections from the remote server.

Parameters:
connectionIds - An array of connection Id's. Connections with these object id's are fetched.
relationType - The name of the relation. Connections of this relation are retrieved.
callback - Callback invoked when the fetch operation is successful or failed.

Search for all Connections of a particular relation type.

Parameters:
relationType - The relation type that the connections should belong to.

                                        AppacitiveFetchCallback callback)

searchConnections

public static void searchConnections(java.lang.String relationType,
                                     java.lang.String query,
                                     AppacitiveFetchCallback callback)
Searches for Connections and filters the result according to the query provided.

Parameters:
relationType - The relation type that the connections should belong to.
query - SQL kind of query to search for specific objects. For more info http://appacitive.com
callback - Callback invoked when the search operation is successful or failed.

searchForConnectedArticles

public static void searchForConnectedArticles(java.lang.String relationType,
                                              long articleId)
Parameters:
relationType -
articleId -
See Also:
searchForConnectedArticles(String relationType, long articleId, AppacitiveFetchCallback callback)

searchForConnectedArticles

public static void searchForConnectedArticles(java.lang.String relationType,
                                              long articleId,
                                              AppacitiveFetchCallback callback)
Searches for all the connections from the specified articleId, and returns the list of all the connections of the specified relationType from that article along with the oher endpoints article.

Parameters:
relationType - The name of the relation. Connections of this relation are retrieved.
articleId - The aritcleId of any one endpoint.
callback - Callback invoked when the search operation is successful or failed.
